items.title: Show HN: I built an open source drag and drop editor for Genkit AI flows
items.raw_excerpt:
Hi, I have been building small AI Agents for quite some time now using various frameworks and one thing that always bugged me was that iterating on small things like prompts, flows, tools etc always took a code change + deployment of the app. While the prompt part can be solved with Langfuse I haven't found a good way to keep the flow management remote (and open source). Lately I have been working with Genkit ( https://github.com/firebase/genkit ) and love how modular it is. So I thought why not build a UI builder on top of that that can handle simple flows, prompts and basic tracing. And here we are with a first early version: https://flowshapr.ai Repo: https://github.com/flowshapr/flowshapr This first release can - Manage and execute simple flows remotely
- Works with GoogleAI, Anthropic

title_i18n.en: Show HN: I built an open source drag and drop editor for Genkit AI flows
title_i18n.zh: 展示 HN：我构建了一个用于 Genkit AI 流程的开源拖放编辑器
title_i18n.es: Mostrar HN: Creé un editor de arrastrar y soltar de código abierto para flujos de Genkit AI

excerpt_i18n.en:
Hi, I have been building small AI Agents for quite some time now using various frameworks and one thing that always bugged me was that iterating on small things like prompts, flows, tools etc always took a code change + deployment of the app. While the prompt part can be solved with Langfuse I haven't found a good way to keep the flow management remote (and open source). Lately I have been working with Genkit ( https://github.com/firebase/genkit ) and love how modular it is. So I thought why not build a UI builder on top of that that can handle simple flows, prompts and basic tracing. And here we are with a first early version: https://flowshapr.ai Repo: https://github.com/flowshapr/flowshapr This first release can - Manage and execute simple flows remotely
- Works with GoogleAI, Anthropic

items.title: Graduated, No Job, Built AI Apps and Full-Stack Projects
items.raw_excerpt: Hi HN, I just graduated from college and don’t have a job yet. I’m trying to figure out what to focus on next, and I’d love some advice. A little about me: – I contribute to *open-source projects*. – I’ve done a few *internships during college*, mainly building full-stack web apps. – Worked in a few startups, also mainly on *full-stack projects*. – Built *full-stack apps for clients*. – Ran a *fun YouTube channel* for a few months. – Built some *AI-powered apps* using tools like OpenAI. – Solved *100+ DSA problems* to improve my coding skills. With AI tools now, I can build full-stack apps by prompting and understand all the code. But I’m not sure what to focus on next: Should I *deeply master a stack like MERN*, or keep experimenting with AI and building different projects? I’ve tried a l

title_i18n.zh: 毕业无业，开发人工智能应用与全栈项目
title_i18n.es: Graduado, sin trabajo, construí aplicaciones de IA y proyectos full-stack.

excerpt_i18n.en: Hi HN, I just graduated from college and don’t have a job yet. I’m trying to figure out what to focus on next, and I’d love some advice. items.title: AI 本地跑？Google 新开源模型上线，本地量化后占用不到 200MB 内存，支持百余语言

title_i18n.zh: AI 本地跑？Google 新开源模型上线，本地量化后占用不到 200MB 内存，支持百余语言
title_i18n.en: Running AI locally? Google's newly open-sourced model is now available, occupying less than 200MB of memory after local quantization and supporting over a hundred languages.
title_i18n.es: ¿Ejecutar IA localmente? El nuevo modelo de código abierto de Google ya está disponible, ocupando menos de 200 MB de memoria tras la cuantización local, compatible con más de cien idiomas.
